title: Make video preview look realistic with cinematic quality

requirements.text: Redesign the video preview area in VideoResultScreen (specifically the animated placeholder/shimmer element at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1] and its heading at /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/h1[1]) to look realistic and cinematic. Replace the current simple shimmer/gradient placeholder with a rich, film-quality animated preview that includes: a deep black letterboxed frame with subtle film grain texture overlay, a multi-layered animated gradient simulating real video color grading (warm highlights, cool shadows), a realistic scan-line or light-leak animation pass, a subtle camera-focus pulse effect, and a 'HD' or resolution badge in the corner. The heading text above the preview should read 'Your Video is Ready' with a cinematic glow effect.

quotes: jo video bane wo realistic lage

acceptanceCriteria: The video preview area at the specified XPath shows a visually rich animated placeholder that resembles a real video playing (not a plain shimmer box)
The preview includes at least: a dark letterbox frame, animated color-grading gradient layers, film grain or scan-line texture, and a camera-focus pulse
The heading above the preview reads 'Your Video is Ready' and has a visible cinematic glow or text-shadow effect
All animations loop smoothly without flickering
The preview fills its container and maintains a 16:9 aspect ratio
The overall impression is of a high-quality, professionally generated video

requirements.text: Add CSS keyframe animations in the global stylesheet to support the realistic video preview effect: define a 'filmGrain' animation that randomly shifts a noise-like background, a 'colorGrade' animation that smoothly transitions through cinematic color tones (teal shadows → warm highlights), a 'scanLine' animation that moves a semi-transparent horizontal bar top to bottom, and a 'focusPulse' animation that subtly scales the preview between 1.0 and 1.003 to simulate camera breathing. Register these animations in tailwind.config.js so they can be applied as Tailwind utility classes.

quotes: jo video bane wo realistic lage

acceptanceCriteria: filmGrain, colorGrade, scanLine, and focusPulse keyframe animations are defined in index.css
Animations are registered in tailwind.config.js under theme.extend.keyframes and theme.extend.animation
Each animation loops indefinitely and runs at an appropriate speed (scanLine: 3s, colorGrade: 6s, focusPulse: 4s, filmGrain: 0.5s)
No existing animations are removed or broken

constraints: Only modify the video preview area (div) and heading (h1) at the specified XPaths inside VideoResultScreen — do not change layout, buttons, or metadata sections
Do not remove or break existing download/share/generate-again buttons
Do not modify files in frontend/src/hooks/ or frontend/src/components/ui
nonGoals: Playing actual video files — the preview remains a CSS-animated placeholder
Adding new backend endpoints or changing Motoko code
Changing the navigation flow or other screens
Modifying the credit system or authentication
